extractions.description: The paper introduces Dr. DRL, a self-healing approach for deep reinforcement learning (DRL) systems. It leverages intentional forgetting to prioritize the adaptation of critical problem-solving skills in the face of environmental drifts. The approach uses continual learning (CL) combined with intentional forgetting to enhance the adaptability, reduce healing time, and improve performance of DRL agents in drifted environments.

title.value: An Intentional Forgetting-Driven Self-Healing Method For Deep Reinforcement Learning Systems
title.justification: The title is extracted directly from the provided paper information.
title.quote: An Intentional Forgetting-Driven Self-Healing Method For Deep Reinforcement Learning Systems

type.justification: The research includes experimental evaluations of the proposed methodology on various environments, making it empirical.
type.quote: To demonstrate the effectiveness of Dr. DRL, we evaluate it on purposefully drifted gym environments with different drifting intensities.

research_field.justification: The paper discusses methods and experiments related to deep reinforcement learning, which is a subset of deep learning.
research_field.quote: Deep reinforcement learning (DRL) is increasingly applied in large-scale productions like Netflix and Facebook.

sub_research_field.justification: The focus of the paper is specifically on deep reinforcement learning methods and their adaptability to environmental drifts.
sub_research_field.quote: Deep reinforcement learning (DRL), the blend of deep learning (DL) and reinforcement learning (RL), has shown promising achievements in recent years.

type.quote: Deep Q-Learning (DQN) [31, 48] is a popular value-based algorithm that leverages neural network to approximate the action-value function, Q.

type.quote: Soft Actor-Critic (SAC) [32] is a hybrid DRL algorithm. It focuses on maximizing returns and policy entropy (i.e., degree of its 'randomness'), simultaneously.
